pr_title: Rectify the validation condition & add functional test

timeline.message: Rectify the validation condition & add functionalTest
Rectify the validation condition & add functionalTest

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't this be bucketConfig.duration() instead of bucketConfig.duration().duration()
timeline.author: nitisht

replies.bodyText:
bucketConfig.duration() returns a RetentionDuration object which actually contains the duration and unit i.e. days or years.
Returning bucketConfig.duration()  will  just print the object which is  composed of the name of the class, an @ symbol and the hashcode of the object in hexadecimal.
We need to fetch the exact duration and unit and thus this change is needed.
replies.author: sinhaashish

replies.bodyText: Have toString() to RetentionDurationDays and RetentionDurationYears classes to have friendlier message.
replies.author: balamurugana

timeline.bodyText: Have no arg constructor to RetentionDurationYears too.
timeline.author: balamurugana

timeline.bodyText:
This fix is incorrect. Either both values non-null or null. i.e. mode != null && duration != null and mode == null && duration == null are valid.
Basically you need to have current if as else if

timeline.bodyText:
we would need to have two separate tests here.

enableObjectLegalHold() - enable legal hold on an object; on success, overwrite/delete object should fail
disableObjectLegalHold() - disable legal hold on an object; on success, overwrite/delete object should succeed

timeline.bodyText: After setting enableObjectLegalHold we should attempt deleting the object and confirm that fails.
timeline.author: nitisht

replies.bodyText:
This was earlier implemented, but removed as of now as it works with MinIO, but when ran against S3 with versionId as null it succeeds. (deleted the object).
You need specific object version to fail thus it was removed.
replies.author: sinhaashish

replies.bodyText: IMO we can target to validate MinIO implementation
replies.author: nitisht

timeline.bodyText: Here after disableObjectLegalHold we can attempt a delete and confirm that works
timeline.author: nitisht

timeline.bodyText: Here also we can attempt an upload and confirm the uploaded object can't be deleted.
timeline.author: nitisht

replies.bodyText: If we do so, we can't do clean up of the test.
replies.author: balamurugana

replies.bodyText: IMO Testing the MinIO Server's behaviour is more important, since this test will become part of Mint. It will be used to validate MinIO Server behaviour. We generally test against Play or Local MinIO instances - in both cases cleanup is not that important
replies.author: nitisht
